New Records: The Chicago White Sox set a new franchise record with 107 losses in a season after their loss to the New York Mets on September 1, 2024.
Key Match Events: The White Sox lost the game 2-0 to the New York Mets, marking their 107th loss of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox postgame show hosts Chuck Garfien and Ozzie Guillen expressed frustration and embarrassment over the team's poor performance and record-breaking losses.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loss capped a 0-10 homestand, setting another franchise record for the White Sox.
